resource_dependency.restaurantDataSchema: Database table 'restaurants' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), address (text), location POINT, cuisine_type (string), rating_avg (float), created_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.recipeDataSchema: Database table 'recipes' with fields: id (UUID), title (string), ingredients (text[]), preparation_time (integer), difficulty_level (string), rating_avg (float), created_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.reviewDataSchema: Database table 'reviews' with fields: id (UUID), user_id (UUID), restaurant_id (UUID, nullable), recipe_id (UUID, nullable), rating (integer), review_text (text), created_at (timestamp)

function: A frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs
static_description: The main web page displays a header navigation bar with links to Home, Restaurants, Recipes, and Reviews sections. Below the header is a hero section with a search bar centered on a lemon chiffon background. Main content area shows cards for restaurants and recipes styled with chocolate borders.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any restaurant or recipe card navigates to its detailed view page.
Infinite scrolling loads additional restaurant and recipe cards dynamically as the user scrolls down.

resource_dependency.postgresConnectionConfig: Environment variables configuration: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: A backend application that connects to a PostgreSQL database using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
static_description: Backend server initialized with connection pool configured using provided environment variables. Server listens on port 3001 by default.

resource_dependency.websocketAPI: WebSocket endpoint at /ws for real-time updates
resource_dependency.restaurantUpdateEndpoint: GET /api/restaurants/updates returning stream of restaurant changes

function: Real-time display of restaurant and recipe information
static_description: Restaurant and recipe listings show a 'Live Updates' indicator badge in top right corner. Cards include timestamp showing last update time.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Enable Live Updates' toggles WebSocket connection to receive real-time notifications about restaurant and recipe changes.
Hovering over the live update badge shows tooltip explaining real-time functionality.

resource_dependency.geolocationAPI: Browser Geolocation API for fetching current position

static_description: Dedicated 'Nearby Restaurants' section featuring a map visualization alongside list view of local establishments. Default zoom level focuses on current location with markers indicating restaurant positions.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Find My Location' prompts browser geolocation permission request and fetches restaurants within 5km radius.
Dragging the map updates displayed restaurant list based on new center coordinates.

function: Search functionality for finding specific recipes
static_description: Recipe search interface includes a prominent search bar with filter dropdowns below. Results appear in grid layout with recipe thumbnails and brief metadata beneath each card.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking filter dropdown reveals options for cuisine type, difficulty level, and prep time. Selected filters apply immediately to refine results.
Pressing Enter after typing in search field submits query to backend API and refreshes result list.

resource_dependency.userProfileSchema: Database table 'users' with fields: id (UUID), username (string), avatar_url (text)

function: Ability to view user reviews and ratings for restaurants and recipes
static_description: Each restaurant and recipe detail page contains a dedicated 'Reviews' tab showing star ratings summary above individual user comments. Reviews are listed chronologically with user avatars, usernames, date posted, and full text.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the sort dropdown allows ordering reviews by newest, oldest, highest rated, or lowest rated.
Scrolling to bottom of reviews list automatically loads older entries via pagination.

resource_dependency.submitReviewEndpoint: POST /api/reviews with body {target_type, target_id, rating, review_text}
resource_dependency.authState: User authentication context required for posting reviews

function: Ability for users to add their own reviews and ratings
static_description: At the end of every restaurant and recipe review list, authenticated users see a form containing a 5-star rating selector and multiline text input field labeled 'Write your review'. Unauthenticated users see a prompt to log in before reviewing.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking stars highlights selected rating value. Clicking 'Submit Review' sends data to backend API and appends new review to list without page reload.
While focusing on review textarea, pressing Shift+Enter creates line break. Pressing Ctrl+Enter submits the review directly.

function: UI styled with lemon chiffon background and chocolate-colored components
static_description: Entire application uses #FFFACD as base background color applied globally through CSS variables. All buttons, cards, headers, and interactive elements use #D2691E for primary styling including borders, accents, and hover states.

interaction_and_states.description: All chocolate-colored interactive elements slightly darken on hover using CSS transition effect.
Buttons depress visually when clicked with subtle shadow inset effect matching theme colors.

resource_dependency.installScript: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\""

function: Package.json configured with `npm run install:all` to install both frontend and backend dependencies
static_description: Root package.json file includes custom script entry under scripts section that executes concurrent installation commands targeting frontend and backend directories.

resource_dependency.devStartScript: "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\" --names \"FE,BE\" --prefix name"
resource_dependency.processManager: Concurrently npm package used for parallel execution

function: Package.json configured with `npm run dev` to start both frontend and backend concurrently
static_description: Development command defined in root package.json utilizes concurrently utility to launch frontend development server on port 3000 and backend API server on port 3001 simultaneously.

resource_dependency.getRestaurantsEndpoint: GET /api/restaurants with optional query params for filtering

function: API endpoints for retrieving restaurant data
static_description: RESTful API exposes collection endpoint for listing restaurants and individual resource endpoint for accessing specific restaurant details. Both support standard HTTP GET method only.

resource_dependency.getRecipesEndpoint: GET /api/recipes with search and filter capabilities

function: API endpoints for retrieving recipe data
static_description: Backend provides searchable recipes endpoint supporting query parameters along with direct access endpoint for fetching comprehensive recipe record by unique identifier.

function: API endpoints for retrieving user reviews and ratings
static_description: Two distinct endpoints serve review dataâ€”one for fetching individual comments and another optimized for calculating average ratings across targets.

resource_dependency.validationRules: Rating between 1-5 inclusive, review_text maximum length 1000 characters

function: API endpoints for submitting new user reviews and ratings
static_description: Protected POST endpoint accepts structured review payload including target reference, numerical rating, and optional textual feedback. Requires valid authorization token in request headers.

resource_dependency.responsiveFramework: CSS media queries and flexbox/grid layouts

function: Responsive design compatible with modern browsers
static_description: Application layout adapts fluidly from mobile portrait through desktop widescreen using responsive units and breakpoints at 768px and 1024px widths. Grid-based components reflow appropriately per viewport size.

interaction_and_states.description: Resizing browser window triggers layout recalculations ensuring optimal presentation across device sizes.
Text scaling up to 200% maintains readability and functional control accessibility throughout interface.
